Shows interest in creative and interactive tasks like games and short videos. Responds better when learning feels fun and flexible.
Resists structured sketch foundation lessons. Enjoys freedom-based projects such as crafts or choice-driven design.
When engaged, works efficiently and demonstrates quick understanding. Focus improves with autonomy and clear goals.

goals.text: Rebuild engagement: 3 choice-based sessions (game-character, robot, or creature) using simple forms.
Foundation bridge: 2 mini-lessons on volume (box → cylinder → add cast shadow) inside his chosen subject.
Project: 1 character sheet (front/side + pose) with light & shadow callouts.

critiques.strength: Strong ideas when choice is given; confident lines during short sprints.
critiques.next: Chunk tasks into 10–15 minute sessions; add simple structure using large shapes before detail.

strengths: Enjoys challenge when given creative control
challenges: Needs autonomy and short-term goals to stay motivated
strategy: Start sessions with his own creative choices (e.g., game or robot theme).
Attach a single technical goal to each session (light, volume, proportion).
Use short 10–15 minute sprints with visual checkpoints.
Guide him toward project-based outcomes like a character sheet.
